Airlangga Bicara Dampak Hong Kong dan Singapura yang Hadapi Resesi
05 Nov 2019, 04:55 by Vadhia Lidyana


Ilustrasi Kondisi Hong Kong Foto: Reuters

Jakarta - Dua negara tengah menghadapi resesi, yakni Singapura dan Hong Kong. Meski Singapura sendiri belum jatuh ke jurang resesi seperti Hong Kong, namun pertumbuhan ekonominya masih rendah dan terancam resesi. Pertumbuhan ekonomi Singapura secara tahunan atau year on year di kuartal III-2019 dibandingkan kuartal III-2018 hanya tumbuh 0,1%.Lantas, bagaimana dampaknya terhadap perekonomian Indonesia?Menjawab hal tersebut, Menteri Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto menuturkan, perekonomian Indonesia lebih didominasi oleh pasar dalam negeri. Sehingga, gejolak perekonomian luar negeri tak banyak berpengaruh terhadap Indonesia."Ya kalau perekonomian Indonesia kan kita punya domestik market yang cukup bagus," kata Airlangga di kantornya, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Selain itu, Airlangga mengatakan, saat ini Indonesia tengah meneken perjanjian dagang Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP). Perjanjian perdagangan bebas itu menurutnya akan semakin mengerek perekonomian RI.Airlangga menilai, di tengah perlambatan ekonomi global dengan adanya resesi yang dihadapi dua negara tersebut, lalu adanya perang dagang AS-China, dan juga Brexit RCEP ini bisa menjadi solusi."Memang kan selama ini Singapura dan Hong Kong sudah slow down. Apalagi Hong Kong terkait dengan banyaknya persoalan internal. Jadi kalau kita lihat dari segi ekonomi keseluruhan, Amerika masih positiflah domestiknya masih kuat. Kemudian ada masalah brexit dan yang lain. Oleh karena itu, kita bahas terkait blok baru yang namanya RCEP. Jadi RCEP ini kan East Asia Free Trade Agreement (FTA). Dan ini adalah terbesar dibandingkan seluruh blok perdagangan," terang Airlangga.Menurutnya, RCEP punya efek yang lebih besar terhadap perekonomian Indonesia dibandingkan resesi yang menerapa Hong Kong."Ya karena kan RCEP jauh lebih besar drpd Hong Kong dan yang lain," ujar dia.Selain itu, perdagangan RI dengan Hong Kong dinilainya tak begitu besar. Menurut Airlangga, peran Hong Kong terhadap perdagangan Indonesia lebih ke pada transhipment atau lokasi transit perdagangan ke China. "Hong Kong kan transhipment ke China. Tapi sekarang fungsinya sudah banyak berubah karena sekarang perdagangan dengan China langsung," tandasnya. Airlangga Talks about the Impact of Hong Kong and Singapore Facing Recession
05 Nov 2019, 04:55 by Vadhia Lidyana


Illustration of Hong Kong Conditions Photo: Reuters

Jakarta - Two countries are facing a recession, namely Singapore and Hong Kong. Although Singapore itself has not yet fallen into recession like Hong Kong, its economic growth is still low and threatened with recession. Singapore's economic growth on an annual basis or year on year in the third quarter-2019 compared to the third quarter-2018 only grew 0.1%. Then, how does it impact on the Indonesian economy? Answering this, Coordinating Minister for the Economy Airlangga Hartarto said, Indonesia's economy was more dominated by the domestic market. So, the turmoil of the foreign economy does not have much effect on Indonesia. "Yes, if the Indonesian economy we have a pretty good domestic market," Airlangga said in his office, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019). In addition, Airlangga said, when Indonesia is currently signing a regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) trade agreement. According to him, the free trade agreement will further hoist the Indonesian economy. Nonprofit assesses, amid the global economic slowdown with the recession faced by the two countries, then the US-China trade war, and also the RCEP Brexit can be a solution. " Singapore and Hong Kong have been slow down, especially since Hong Kong is related to many internal problems, so if we look at it from the overall economic perspective, America is still positive, its domestic strength is still strong, then there are brexit issues and so on. called RCEP. So RCEP is East Asia Free Trade Agreement (FTA). And this is the biggest compared to all trade blocs, "explained Airlangga. According to him, RCEP had a greater effect on the Indonesian economy compared to the recession that hit Hong Kong." Yes because RCEP is much bigger than Hong Kong and others, "he said. In addition, RI's trade with Hong Kong was assessed a not so big. According to Airlangga, Hong Kong's role in Indonesian trade is more on transhipment or trade transit locations to China. "Hong Kong has transshipment to China. But now its function has changed a lot because now it is trading with China directly," he said.
